dct_title_s: NOVUS ORBIS potius ALTERA CONTINENS Sive ATLANTIS INSULA à NICOLAO SANSON Antiquitati Restituta; Nunc demum Majori Forma delineata, et in decem REGNA, Iuxta decem Neptuni Filios Distributa. Præterea INSULÆ, NOSTRÆQ CONTINENTIS REGIONES quibus Imperavere ATLANTICI REGES; aut quas Armis Tentavere. ex Conatibus Geographicis
dct_description_sm: With changed imprint: A PARIS Chès le S.ROBERT Geog. du Roi quai de l'Horloge, 1741, otherwise same as State 5: Six words added to beginning of title, above shading, which continues as Tropicus Capricorni: NOVUS ORBIS potius ALTERA CONTINENS Sive ... ; additional foliage extends cartouche above Tropicus Capricorni; With ASIA labelled. Also, text in small paragraphs placed throughout map is reformated with no change to content.
LC 3283 & 5628; Tooley 51 & 52; Leighly 95; BN Sanson V D 208 (Fig.137); Nordenskïold Collection, 2, 275(53); Burden 405 (Plate 405).
California on second Sanson model, with indented northern coast; and with no place names.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
